channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report E-2023090194
item.description:
Report E-2023090194

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 1, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1789 was crushed during transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools. All freight was wiped down and repalletized for further handling by R+L terminal personnel. All spent absorbents, cleanup debris, and the empty, damaged 5-gallon pail were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drum that was labeled and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2023090145
item.description:
Report E-2023090145

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 25, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1760 was crushed during transit and released approximately two (2) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents and neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer and swept them in utilizing hand tools. All UN1760-impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023080885
item.description:
Report X-2023080885

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered in QA damages, package came from van lines punctured, wet & stained with something brown. Package was immediately bagged & placed in a Hazmat tote. Inspected items in package for loose caps or punctures. Although there was no visible damage to bottles, one of them was slightly leaking but not certain from where. DescribePack: There is a big puncture on the box. Bottom of box was ripped open possibly because of the internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was bagged & placed in a Hazmat tote to prevent any further damage.

item.title: Report I-2023070017
item.description:
Report I-2023070017

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: Denver
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 3
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As flight 663(DEN-MEM) departed DEN and after passing flight level 100, a passengers lithium batteries went into thermal runaway. The batteries exited the passengers carryon bag and shrapnel from the explosion hit a few other passengers which caused some minor burns. The flight crew extinguished and cooled the batteries and placed them in the onboard containment bag. The aircraft diverted back to DEN where the batteries were removed and first aid was administered to the passengers. Passenger had the 18650 batteries in his carryon bag and installed in a charging cradle.

item.title: Report I-2023060127
item.description:
Report I-2023060127

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-27
  • City: KEENESBURG
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PLAINS MARKETING, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 4/27/2023, at approximately 07:30, a Plains transport driver with a load of crude oil was traveling westbound on Highway 52. At the intersection of Highway 52 and WCR 65, a Weld County SD school bus pulled out into the westbound lane of travel of Highway 52 from WCR 65. The Plains transport unit collided with the front passenger side portion of the school bus. The Plains employee was injured and treated at a medical facility, and a Non-DOT D&A test was completed when medically released. No injuries to the passengers or driver of the school bus were reported from the occupants. As a result of the collision, the Plains transport released approximately 30 barrels of crude oil contained on-site. The Plains company vehicle and the Weld County SD school bus were non-drivable and had to be towed from the scene.

item.title: Report X-2023081165
item.description:
Report X-2023081165

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-02
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking in the unload. It was taken to QA for inspection. Upon inspection, contents were found with a cap that had been slightly ajar, enough for the seal o be broken and contents to leak. DescribePack: Cap was found raised slightly, about half an inch up. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a damage tote with liner, orientation arrows being followed. Cap was then pressed back into place.
